intro: Melaleuca densispicata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tea tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal or sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and forest margins. Its aromatic leaves contain essential oils, which have been used in traditional medicine and for their antiseptic properties. Melaleuca densispicata is also valued for its ecological role in supporting native wildlife and stabilizing soil in coastal environments.
